# instead of installing jupyter and its dependencies over public apt-get and # pip repositories, the sources and packages will be downloaded from a private # repository server cd /home/ubuntu su ubuntu -c "wget http://reposerver/jupyter/jupyter.tar.gz" su ubuntu -c "tar -xzf /home/ubuntu/jupyter.tar.gz"
dpkg -i /home/ubuntu/jupyter/pythonpip/* pip install --no-deps /home/ubuntu/jupyter/pipjupyter/six-1.10.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl pip install --no-deps /home/ubuntu/jupyter/pipjupyter/*
# create jupyter_notebook_config.py: su ubuntu -c "mkdir /home/ubuntu/.jupyter" cat - >> /home/ubuntu/.jupyter/jupyter_notebook_config.py << 'EOF' # See http://ipython.org/ipython-doc/1/interactive/public_server.html for more information. # Configuration file for ipython-notebook. import os
c = get_config() c.NotebookApp.ip = '0.0.0.0' c.NotebookApp.port = 8888 c.NotebookApp.open_browser = False c.NotebookApp.profile = u'default' c.IPKernelApp.matplotlib = 'inline'
headers = { 'X-Frame-Options': 'ALLOWALL', } c.NotebookApp.allow_origin = '*' c.NotebookApp.allow_credentials = True
c.NotebookApp.base_url = '/' c.NotebookApp.webapp_settings = {'static_url_prefix':'/static/'}
if os.environ.get('NOTEBOOK_PASSWORD', 'none') != 'none': c.NotebookApp.password = os.environ['NOTEBOOK_PASSWORD']
if os.environ.get('CORS_ORIGIN', 'none') != 'none': c.NotebookApp.allow_origin = os.environ['CORS_ORIGIN']
c.NotebookApp.webapp_settings['headers'] = headers c.NotebookApp.token = u'' EOF chown ubuntu:ubuntu /home/ubuntu/.jupyter/jupyter_notebook_config.py su ubuntu -c "jupyter-notebook &" deploymentLog "jupyter ready" # jupyter is installed and running
